author: C. F. Lawor
description: A boozy sipper of a cocktail that's medium dry with honeyed richness. Gin-based with zesty orange freshness and sweet vermouth adding deep herbal complexity. A great after-dinner cocktail that also works well on-the-rocks.This should not be confused with the more commonplace equal parts gin, Chartreuse and vermouth Bijou which first appeared in Harry Johnson's 1900 Bartender's Manual.
name: Bijou Cocktail (inspired by Lawlor's 1895 recipe)
recipeIngredient: 22.5 ml Grand Marnier or other cognac orange liqueur

recipeInstructions.text: STIR all ingredients with ice and strain into chilled glass
